byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Lebanon.

abstract: United Nations-backed Special Tribunal for Lebanon finds Al Jadeed TV executive Karma al-Khayat guilty of contempt of court for failing to follow court's order to remove broadcasts about confidential witnesses from station's website; is first conviction handed down by court, which is tasked with inquiry into killing of former Lebanese Prime Min Rafik Hariri, although charges have little to do with Hariri; case has raised concerns about freedom of press.
lead_paragraph: The Hariri tribunal found Karma al-Khayat of Al Jadeed TV guilty of contempt for broadcasting interviews with potential confidential witnesses, but was acquitted of obstruction of justice.

headline.main: Lebanon Tribunal Gives Mixed Verdict in Confidential Witnesses Case
headline.print_headline: Mixed Verdict for Lebanese TV Executive in Witnesses Case

snippet: The Hariri tribunal found Karma al-Khayat of Al Jadeed TV guilty of contempt for broadcasting interviews with potential confidential witnesses, but was acquitted of obstruction of justice.
